TopicTitle: Ask a stupid question, Get a stupid answer back.

Articles.Content:
Mooooooo Trapping

TUBM has a dog & plays KSP with 300 mods and has 500 fps

...Somewhat?

 

According to all known laws of aviation, is there a way bees are able to fly?

No, because we've only studied fixed-wing aviation.

Can a Von Neumann probe of arbitrarily small size devour a planet?

5,because milk has no bones.

is it hotter in the summer, or in the city?

5 minutes ago, Boorang said:

5,because milk has no bones.

is it hotter in the summer, or in the city?

 

In the city because the summer bounces off the walls of buildings and is amplified by the following formula:

(34/T * 16) - 73/W*7

Where 'T' equals the current temperature, and 'W*7' equals the nonexistent wind chill.

How do I open those 'child-proof' containers where you have to press down and twist or something.

Short of spending money on a chainsaw, I mean.

Those are expensive, unless it's one of the small ones...

try pressing a hollow glass bead into blasting gel,then light the fuse.

if put it in the right place the shaped charge effect + shrapnel should smash it.

how do I post?

Edited November 29, 2017 by Boorang

Be more like this:

Why isn't the sky more topwise?

You're looking at the artificial horizon upside-down, silly boy!

 

Why is soup?

Because it is opposite to sodown.

Is it better soleft or soright?

Because bacon has no nerves.

 

If the word "laughter" is pronounced as "laffter", why is "daughter" not pronounced as "daffter"?

Because the English language is extremely complex, in the way that nearly every word of the language has its own evolution, combining with other terms and ways of saying it to form something completely different. The word Laughter originated from the Germanic/Old English word hleahtor, and the German word Gelächter. Meanwhile, the word daughter originated from the Germanic dohtor, Duch dochter, and German Tochter. Different origins, but it seems like the modern English spelling convention brought these two words together with the "aughter" ending.

Why 3, if not 5?

Because thus spake Fibonacci.

Why not just add a special letter for "aught"? Say, §.
Then: d§er = daughter, l§er = laughter, c§ = caught

Cause thats the section symbol. And laziness/hard to force into convention.

If after flies fly flies, do flies fly after flies?

The fly leader doesn't, unless they fly around something as a circle-shaped swarm.

Why Apollo rovers weren't equipped with fur dice?

Edited December 12, 2017 by kerbiloid

The wind would have blown them away.

 

Where is the current location of Waldo?

Utilizing the International Waldo Location Platform that will be launched to orbit in <<CLASSIFIED>>, it will be able to detect Waldo at any given time.

 

Why is the goat upside-down?

5, because milk has no bones

do you answer yes to the question "do you answer no to this question"?

Sure.

Is a laboratory sentient?

Only rats. Others just imitate.

When ISS whie surface gets dirty, do they send water to wash it, or lime to whitewash?

They send chickens with lime to whitewash it in their mouth because chickens don't fly everywhere.

Whats the DeltaV of me farting?

Almost the amount you need, but just barely not enough.

Is it possible to make a correct amount of pasta?

Eat pant.

Is it possible to eat an X-ray for dinner?

If as "dinner" you mean the late day meal, then yes, of course.
If as "dinner" you mean the early night day meal,  then you would wait for the dawn, when your native neutron star rises above the horizon.

How will the mining corporations delimit a neutron star regions?

Edited December 22, 2017 by kerbiloid

On 11/25/2017 at 8:23 AM, xkerbal said:

How much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck could wood

A woodchuck would chuck as much as he could if a woodchuck could chuck wood.
